Package com.github.tommyettinger.cringe

Class LineWobble

java.lang.Object
com.github.tommyettinger.cringe.LineWobble
public final class LineWobble extends Object
Provides 1D noise methods that can be queried at any point on a line to get a continuous random value. These each use some form of low-quality, high-speed unary hash on the floor and ceiling of a float or double value, then interpolate between the hash results. Some of these work on angles (so they wrap like a line around a circle) instead of normal lines.
The wobble methods that take a seed and a distance along a line as a value are:
  • wobble(float, int) is straightforward; it uses a hermite spline to interpolate two points.
  • bicubicWobble(float, long) uses bicubic interpolation on 4 points, and tends to be smooth.
  • splineWobble(float, int) can be much more sharp or smooth, varying randomly over its length.
  • splineWobble() also can take a long seed.
  • trigWobble(float, int) is a trigonometric wobble, using sine to smoothly transition.
There are also some methods to get a wobbling angle, smoothly wrapping around the angle 0:
  • wobbleAngle(float, int) is a simple wobble with output in radians.
  • wobbleAngleDeg(float, int) is a simple wobble with output in degrees.
  • wobbleAngleTurns(float, int) is a simple wobble with output in turns (1 turn == 360 degrees).
  • splineWobbleAngle(float, int) is a more-random wobble with output in radians.
  • splineWobbleAngleDeg(float, int) is a more-random wobble with output in degrees.
  • splineWobbleAngleTurns(float, int) is a more-random wobble with output in turns (1 turn == 360 degrees).
  • Each of the splineWobbleAngle() methods also can take a long seed.

  • Method Details

    • wobble

      public static float wobble(float value, int seed)
      A type of 1D noise that takes an int seed and is optimized for usage on GWT. This uses cubic interpolation between random peak or valley points.
      Parameters:
      value - a float that typically changes slowly, by less than 1.0, with direction changes at integer inputs
      seed - an int seed that will determine the pattern of peaks and valleys this will generate as value changes; this should not change between calls
      Returns:
      a pseudo-random float between -1f and 1f (both exclusive), smoothly changing with value

    • wobble

      public static float wobble(float value, long seed)
      A type of 1D noise that takes a long seed and is one of the faster "wobble methods" here when used on platforms other than GWT. This uses cubic interpolation between random peak or valley points.
      Parameters:
      value - a float that typically changes slowly, by less than 2.0, with direction changes at integer inputs
      seed - a long seed that will determine the pattern of peaks and valleys this will generate as value changes; this should not change between calls
      Returns:
      a pseudo-random float between -1f and 1f (both exclusive), smoothly changing with value

    • bicubicWobble

      public static float bicubicWobble(float t, int seed)
      Sway smoothly using bicubic interpolation between 4 points (the two integers before t and the two after). This pretty much never produces steep changes between peaks and valleys; this may make it more useful for things like generating terrain that can be walked across in a side-scrolling game.
      Parameters:
      t - a distance traveled; should change by less than 1 between calls, and should be less than about 10000
      seed - any int
      Returns:
      a smoothly-interpolated swaying value between -1 and 1, both exclusive

    • bicubicWobble

      public static float bicubicWobble(float t, long seed)
      Sway smoothly using bicubic interpolation between 4 points (the two integers before t and the two after). This pretty much never produces steep changes between peaks and valleys; this may make it more useful for things like generating terrain that can be walked across in a side-scrolling game.
      Parameters:
      t - a distance traveled; should change by less than 1 between calls, and should be less than about 10000
      seed - any long
      Returns:
      a smoothly-interpolated swaying value between -1 and 1, both exclusive

    • smoothWobble

      public static float smoothWobble(float t, int seed)
      Sway very smoothly using bicubic interpolation between 4 points (the two integers before t and the two after), and additional processing at the last step to push results closer to the min and max valid values. This is nearly the same as bicubicWobble(float, int), but it isn't at all as biased towards central results.
      Parameters:
      t - a distance traveled; should change by less than 1 between calls, and should be less than about 10000
      seed - any int
      Returns:
      a smoothly-interpolated swaying value between -1 and 1, both exclusive

    • smoothWobble

      public static float smoothWobble(float t, long seed)
      Sway very smoothly using bicubic interpolation between 4 points (the two integers before t and the two after), and additional processing at the last step to push results closer to the min and max valid values. This is nearly the same as bicubicWobble(float, long), but it isn't at all as biased towards central results.
      Parameters:
      t - a distance traveled; should change by less than 1 between calls, and should be less than about 10000
      seed - any long
      Returns:
      a smoothly-interpolated swaying value between -1 and 1, both exclusive

    • splineWobble

      public static float splineWobble(float value, int seed)
      A variant on wobble(float, int) that uses MathSupport.barronSpline(float, float, float) to interpolate between peaks/valleys, with the shape and turning point determined like the other values. This can be useful when you want a curve to seem more "natural," without the similarity between every peak or every valley in wobble(float, int). This can produce both fairly sharp turns and very gradual curves.
      Parameters:
      value - a float that typically changes slowly, by less than 2.0, with direction changes at integer inputs
      seed - an int seed that will determine the pattern of peaks and valleys this will generate as value changes; this should not change between calls
      Returns:
      a pseudo-random float between -1f and 1f (both exclusive), smoothly changing with value

    • splineWobble

      public static float splineWobble(float value, long seed)
      A variant on wobble(float, int) that uses MathSupport.barronSpline(float, float, float) to interpolate between peaks/valleys, with the shape and turning point determined like the other values. This can be useful when you want a curve to seem more "natural," without the similarity between every peak or every valley in wobble(float, int). This can produce both fairly sharp turns and very gradual curves.
      Parameters:
      value - a float that typically changes slowly, by less than 2.0, with direction changes at integer inputs
      seed - a long seed that will determine the pattern of peaks and valleys this will generate as value changes; this should not change between calls
      Returns:
      a pseudo-random float between -1f and 1f (both exclusive), smoothly changing with value

    • trigWobble

      public static float trigWobble(float value, long seed)
      Trigonometric wobble. Domain for value is effectively [-16384, 16384]. Range is (-1, 1).
      Parameters:
      value - a float that typically changes slowly, by less than 2.0, with direction changes at integer inputs
      seed - a long seed that will determine the pattern of peaks and valleys this will generate as value changes; this should not change between calls
      Returns:
      a pseudo-random float between -1f and 1f (both exclusive), smoothly changing with value

    • trigWobble

      public static float trigWobble(float value, int seed)
      Trigonometric wobble. Domain for value is effectively [-16384, 16384]. Range is (-1, 1).
      Parameters:
      value - a float that typically changes slowly, by less than 2.0, with direction changes at integer inputs
      seed - an int seed that will determine the pattern of peaks and valleys this will generate as value changes; this should not change between calls
      Returns:
      a pseudo-random float between -1f and 1f (both exclusive), smoothly changing with value

    • wobbleAngle

      public static float wobbleAngle(float value, int seed)
      A 1D "noise" method that produces smooth transitions like a sine wave, but also wrapping around at pi * 2 so this can be used to get smoothly-changing random angles. Has (seeded) random peaks and valleys where it slows its range of change, but can return any value from 0 to 6.283185307179586f, or pi * 2. The pattern this will produce will be completely different if the seed changes, and the value is expected to be something other than an angle, like time. Uses a simple method of cubic interpolation between random values, where a random value is used without modification when given an integer for value. Note that this uses a different type of interpolation than a sine wave would, and the shape here uses cubic interpolation.
      Parameters:
      value - a float that typically changes slowly, by less than 1.0, with possible direction changes at integer inputs
      seed - an int seed that will determine the pattern of peaks and valleys this will generate as value changes; this should not change between calls
      Returns:
      a pseudo-random float between 0f and 6.283185307179586f (both inclusive), smoothly changing with value and wrapping

    • wobbleAngleDeg

      public static float wobbleAngleDeg(float value, int seed)
      A 1D "noise" method that produces smooth transitions like a sine wave, but also wrapping around at 360.0 so this can be used to get smoothly-changing random angles. Has (seeded) random peaks and valleys where it slows its range of change, but can return any value from 0 to 360.0f . The pattern this will produce will be completely different if the seed changes, and the value is expected to be something other than an angle, like time. Uses a simple method of cubic interpolation between random values, where a random value is used without modification when given an integer for value. Note that this uses a different type of interpolation than a sine wave would, and the shape here uses cubic interpolation.
      Parameters:
      value - a float that typically changes slowly, by less than 1.0, with possible direction changes at integer inputs
      seed - an int seed that will determine the pattern of peaks and valleys this will generate as value changes; this should not change between calls
      Returns:
      a pseudo-random float between 0f and 360.0f (both inclusive), smoothly changing with value and wrapping

    • wobbleAngleTurns

      public static float wobbleAngleTurns(float value, int seed)
      A 1D "noise" method that produces smooth transitions like a sine wave, but also wrapping around at 1.0 so this can be used to get smoothly-changing random angles in turns. Has (seeded) random peaks and valleys where it slows its range of change, but can return any value from 0 to 1.0. The pattern this will produce will be completely different if the seed changes, and the value is expected to be something other than an angle, like time. Uses a simple method of cubic interpolation between random values, where a random value is used without modification when given an integer for value. Note that this uses a different type of interpolation than a sine wave would, and the shape here uses cubic interpolation.
      Turns are a way of measuring angles, like radians or degrees, but where a full rotation is 360 in degrees or MathUtils.PI2 in radians, it is 1.0 in turns. This proves handy for things like hue calculations in ColorSupport.hsl2rgb(Color, float, float, float, float).
      Parameters:
      value - a float that typically changes slowly, by less than 1.0, with possible direction changes at integer inputs
      seed - an int seed that will determine the pattern of peaks and valleys this will generate as value changes; this should not change between calls
      Returns:
      a pseudo-random float between 0.0f and 1.0f (both inclusive), smoothly changing with value and wrapping

    • splineWobbleAngle

      public static float splineWobbleAngle(float value, int seed)
      Like splineWobble(float, int), this is a 1D wobble that can become more sharp or more gradual at different points on its length, but this produces a (wrapping) angle measured in radians.
      Parameters:
      value - a float that typically changes slowly, by less than 1.0, with possible direction changes at integer inputs
      seed - an int seed that will determine the pattern of peaks and valleys this will generate as value changes; this should not change between calls
      Returns:
      a pseudo-random float between 0.0f and 6.283185307179586f (both inclusive), smoothly changing with value and wrapping

    • splineWobbleAngleDeg

      public static float splineWobbleAngleDeg(float value, int seed)

      Parameters:
      value - a float that typically changes slowly, by less than 1.0, with possible direction changes at integer inputs
      seed - an int seed that will determine the pattern of peaks and valleys this will generate as value changes; this should not change between calls
      Returns:
      a pseudo-random float between 0.0f and 360.0f (both inclusive), smoothly changing with value and wrapping

    • splineWobbleAngleTurns

      public static float splineWobbleAngleTurns(float value, int seed)
      Like splineWobble(float, int), this is a 1D wobble that can become more sharp or more gradual at different points on its length, but this produces a (wrapping) angle measured in turns.
      Parameters:
      value - a float that typically changes slowly, by less than 1.0, with possible direction changes at integer inputs
      seed - an int seed that will determine the pattern of peaks and valleys this will generate as value changes; this should not change between calls
      Returns:
      a pseudo-random float between 0.0f and 1.0f (both inclusive), smoothly changing with value and wrapping

    • splineWobbleAngle

      public static float splineWobbleAngle(float value, long seed)
